choices: Nami immediately goes searching for Luffy at Sabaody.

15233121111.content:
When Nami first met Luffy, she was a pirate thief who hated all pirates due to what Arlong had to her and her island. However, even then she was drawn to how Luffy was protective of his straw hat, to the point he considered it his treasure. Thus, a thought had crept in Nami's mind that should the opportunity present itself, she would steal his straw hat when she made her goodbye.

However, she did not get that opportunity when she stole the Going Merry to finally free herself from Arlong, but when Luffy later let her wear his straw hat in her moment of weakness, Nami found that the straw hat acually felt quite comfortable and that while she then officially joined the crew after Arlong was defeated, she now secretly desired the straw hat for her own self.

But despite her feelings, Nami could never go through with it and before she knew it, the Straw Hat Pirates were defeated and separated after their defeat on the Sabaody Archpelago, which led to Luffy deciding for the crew to train for 2 years and re-group then.

But during the 2 years of training, Nami had plenty of time to reflect on Luffy's abilities and flaws as Captain.

"Luffy is way too reckless and he never thinks about his actions before he actually does them. What is the point of us all getting stronger if our Captain will just lead us to a situation where we can only hope that someone else will bail us out of trouble?" asked Nami.

Her frustrations led her back to her old thoughts about stealing Luffy's straw hat for herself.

"That's it! The straw hat is Luffy's treasure. If he can't prevent me from stealing it from him, can he really be called our Captain? But it's not enough for me to steal just his straw hat, I gotta make it more challenging. How about I steal all his clothes from him to wear myself and then force him into wearing my clothes? If he can't prevent from doing all that to him, then he can't possibly remain the Captain of the Straw Hat Pirates, let alone the future Pirate King. We're heading for the New World Luffy, you better be prepared for anything."

In her eyesight from the travelling sky island of Weatheria was her destination: the Sabaody Archipelago.

Nami immediately wanted to start looking for Luffy. So as soon as Weatheria reached Sabaody, she bid farewell to the weather scientists that she had been with the last 2 years and went down to Sabaody. Her first stop was to go to a bar to see if she could gather any information since, knowing Luffy, he'd stick out like a sore thumb once he arrived.

To her surprise, she found out that a group of pirates had taken their identities and were causing people to be afraid of them based on the reputations of the real Straw Hat Pirates. However, Nami wasn'y impressed with them at all and that was confirmed when Usopp showed up at the bar and the 2 of them easily defeated the fakes. After talking with Usopp a bit about how he could improve her Clima Tact, Nami excused herself from Usopp so that she could search for Luffy.

Nami hung around the fake Straw Hats that they humiliated as she had a hunch that Luffy would find someway to interact with them as well. And sure enough, she eventually saw a person wearing a coat with a hood over their head with a giant bag on their back. From where she was looking, she got a clear look at the person's face and saw that it was Luffy. After Luffy knocked the fake Straw Hats with a burst of his Haoshoku Haki, Nami began to think.

'What is he doing? Is that his idea of a disguise? It's one thing to wear a coat or something to cover yourself, but that bag is huge, it's just drawing attention to him. But perhaps I can use this to my advantage. If he's trying and failing to lay low, perhaps my best move isn't to greet him, but to just hang in the back and stealthily steal his stuff and clothes one at a time,' thought Nami.

'That bag and coat have got to be the first to go since there's no way that's part of his regular attire now,' thought Nami.

Nami pulled out a small knife as she walked up close behind Luffy, or as close as she could in her way. Nami then started making big cuts in the bag in different areas. Once she was done, Nami went away to watch. Thanks to the cuts that stated to stretch and get even bigger, the meat that was in the bag started to fall out on to the ground.

To Nami's disappointment, because of the size of the bag, Luffy didn't notice that he was losing his precious meat. It wasn't until a few angry civilians walked up to Luffy and told him that he finally realized what was happening. And to no surprise to Nami, once Luffy found out, he started to lose his head and paniic about he was going to save his meat. He quickly took off the bag and tried desperately to put the meat back in the bag, but the more he tried to force it in, the bigger the holes got and even more meat was falling to the ground, making everyone angry.

As the bag was just about empty with all the meat on the ground, Nami got close and saw that the sleeves of the coat were just draped over his shoulders, which was a style that she had seen other pirates and even Marines do. But to Nami, it meant that it would be easier to take off. And sure enough, just as Luffy was in despair as he resorted to just eating the meat right then and there so as not to waste it, Nami swooped in and pulled off the jacket without Luffy even realizing.

Nami then disappeared again and saw that Luffy's attire hadn't changed all that much. He had exchanged his red vest for a long sleeved red cardigan and he had a yellow sash around his waist, but the pants and sandals were about the same.

15233121111111.content:
As Nami had taken the coat that Hancock had given to Luffy, the people all around got a good look at Luffy. However, judging by their experiences with the fake Luffy, they instead believed the Luffy in front of the one was the impostor. They started to slowly surround Luffy in anger that he was such a foolish idiot to imperesonate such an infamous pirate, but Luffy was none the wiser as he finished up all the meat in his now ruined bag so the meat wouldn't go to waste.

When Luffy was done eating, he noticed that everyone around was circling him.

"Is something the matter? I ate up all the meat!"

"If you don't know why we're mad at you, then you're a bigger fool than we thought," said one civilian.

Luffy yelped in surprise as everyone just about jumped on him, but he was able to jump away just outside the circle of people and then started to run away, not wanting to cause a bigger scene before he could meet up with his crew.

"I lost the coat that Hancock gave to me. Oh well, now's not the time," said Luffy to himself as he kept running.

However, Luffy was running in the direction that Luffy was running in and she ducked behind an alleyway that was dark and she put on the coat that she stole to conceal herself even more. She hadn't had the coat on for more than a few moments when Luffy came into the same alleyway and not realizing anyone was there, tripped on the coat and stumbled as he tried to balance himself.

Nami got a hold of herself as she pushed Luffy to a wall that he was right near and started going after his body and arms as she was working on getting Luffy's long sleeved cardigan off of him. Luffy couldn't see who was attacking him between the dark alley and the coat concealing Nami, but he was getting frustrated.

However, before Luffy could understand what was going on, he wa suddenly shoved back into the open street, this time without any shirt on at all. As the crowd saw him and yelled that he was now stripping, Nami took the chance and took off her bikini top and put on Luffy's cardigan on.

"Now that I've taken off his shirt for myself, how do I get it so that Luffy will see this and put it on?" asked Nami to herself.
15233121111111.title: Nami steals his shirt first.

choices: Nami steals his sandals and pants next.
Nami lets him get away from the crowd and let him think it's over first.
152331211111111.content:
Seeing as the crowd was already riled up at Luffy as it were, Nami decided to use that to her advantage again. Nami took her bikini top and from the safety of her hiding spot, she threw it right into the street and it landed right on the ground in between Luffy and the crowd.

Everyone just looked at it, before someone yelled, "There you go, you stripper. Put that on."

"What? I'm not wearing that! That doesn't belong to me."

"Oh, but the shirt you were wearing before was, you impostor?"

"What are you talking about? You're crazy."

"Not as crazy as you for stripping your clothes in public. Now put that on before we make you."

Luffy just wanted to get away from the crazy people around him, so he walked a bit and picked up the bikini top that unbeknwnst to him, belonged to Nami. Figuring to himself that this would be just a temporary thing until he found the person who stole his cardigan, Luffy sighed and worked as he figured out how to put it on.

Once he had it on, Luffy felt embarrassed and Nami was very pleased with how her plans were proceeding.

Nami leaves the clothes while the crowd is still chasing Luffy.
1523312111111111.content:
As the crowd was starting to calm down and leave Luffy alone, Luffy decided to try to get away so he could find the thief who stole his shirt. However, Liffy hadn't gotten very far (and the crowd was still there but they had turned away), when Nami put out her ankle from a corner right in front of Luffy. Luffy didn't see it and he tripped over it as he did so, Nami used the 2 ends of her Clima Tact to pull the sandals right of Luffy's feet andhang on the Clima Tact. Nami then just as quickly, with her free hand, pulled the sash off Luffy and tugged his pants a bit.

All this resulted in Luffy falling to the ground and his pants falling to his knees. Nami took this opportunity and tugged his pants right off, leaving Luffy in hist her bikini top and his underwear. Nami then quickly darted away to put on Luffy's sash, pants, and sandals before anyone saw her.

The crowd that had turned away, heard Luffy's fall, but when they turned to look, Luffy was already stripped of his pants.

Luffy looked down and exclaimed, "What's happening to me? Where's my pants?!" before he got to his feet and just started to run from the crowd who had finally lost their patience with Luffy.

After Luffy and the crowd ran away, Nami emerged wearing Luffy's complete outfit (save for the coat that Hancock gave him, deciding she didn't need that anymore) and holding her jeans, beli buckled belt, and her high heeled sandals, ready to ensure that Luffy would wear them.
1523312111111111.title: Nami steals his sandals and pants next.

choices: Nami follows Luffy some more first, but doesn't steal it just yet.
15233121111111111.content:
Now that Nami was closing in on finishing her plan, she felt that the angry crowd had finished its part, so she ran in the alleyways following Luffy until he was finally able to shake them off. Now, it was just the 2 of them in the area, but Luffy still didn't know that she was around. Nami then took heer jeans, belt, and high heeled sandals and placed them near Luffy so that he would see them.

When Luffy finally did see the clothes, Luffy started to get frustrated and panic a bit at the mind games that this mysterious person was playing.

"Who are you? Why are you doing this to me? Show yourself!" yelled Luffy in desperation, but Nami didn't make a sound or reveal herself.

Luffy was shaking a bit as he just started to look around, but Nami was quick enough to make sure he didn't see her. He yelled in frustration as he hit a wall.

"What is it about Sabaody?! First my crew were defeated and separated here 2 years ago and noww that I've come to reunite, now this mysterious person keeps stealing my clothes and giving me different clothes to wear. But you won't get my straw hat, you hear?!"

Luffy then stared down at the ground and with just above a whisper added, "I don't know what I'd do if I lost that hat."

Luffy then went over to the clothes and put on the jeans and belt (not noticing the beli symbol belt buckle that would've given Luffy a big clue), and then the high heeled sandals.

After stumbling a bit trtying to get used to the high heels on his new sandals, Luffy slowly walked away, just trying to find his crew so he could finally leave Sabaody. And with every few steps, he stopped and looked around, afraid the clothes thief would steal his most precious possession.
15233121111111111.title: Nami waits until Liffy is away from the cowd be...

choices: Nami reveals herself and establishes herself as the new Captain (ending).
Nami leaves Luffy there and heads of to the rest of the crew by herself(ending).
152331211111111111.content:
It didn't take Nami much longer to decide that now was the time to steal Luffy's straw hat, especially with how Luffy was starting to lose his composure. Nami took her Clima Tact and disconnected it a bit and used a Gust Sword attack to hit Luffy in the back of his head and cause the hat to float in the air. Nami then controlled the directions that the straw hat was flying in the air.

As Luffy saw the hat get further and further away, he started to stretch for it. Bur Nami made sure the hat would always swerve in a direction away from Luffy's hands, reading him perfectly. And after a while, Nami floated the hat with her wind high in the sky and Luffy attempted to rocket himself towards it, but just as he was about to release himself, Nami sent another Gust Sword of air pressure at the back of one of his knees, causing him to crash back down to the ground.

And as Luffy was face down on the ground, Nami quickly had the straw hat boomerang back to her by guiding it with the wind and it landed right snugly on her head before Luffy got back up and started looking frantically for it.

"W-what happened? Where did it go?" asked Luffy in stunned disbelief before he yelled out, "Where did my straw hat go?!"

Luffy was now in a full panic and he tried to run, but he still wasn't used to his heeled sandals and it wasn't long until he tripped on the ground. This time, he didn't try to get up, he just stayed laid down on the ground, tears coming down his face. All that pain and sef-doubt he had experience right after the crew's separation and also right after he woke up in the Marineford War's aftermath came rushing back.

"What was the 2 years of training for if I still can't get past this place and get to the New Workd? Is this a sign that I won't be Pirate King?!" yelled Luffy out to no one in particular.

Nami clearly heard it and hearing that and seeing Luffy's defeated demeanor squashed any hidden guilt about what she had been doing to Luffy. If she could not only steal his clothes and hat and get him in her clothes and break his confidence on top of that, then he wasn't fit to be the Captain of the Straw Hat Pirates anymore.
152331211111111111.title: Nami steals the straw hat.

1523312111111111111.content:
After watching Luffy just lay down in despair for a few more moments, Nami decided it was finally time to reveal herselfl. She walked out of the hiding spot she was in and came out in to the open and walked towards Luffy.

When she got close to Luffy, she looked down at him with his full of disappointment and said, "I think it's time for you to get up off the ground, Luffy."

Luffy recognized Nami's voice, but he was too ashamed to turn and see her, but he did respond to her.

"It's awful, Nami. Someone stole my clothes and my straw hat."

"I know."

"And now I don't know-, wait what did you say?"

Luffy got to his knees on the ground and turned and his jaw dropped when he saw her in his clothes and wearing his straw hat.

"You heard me, I know. After all, it was me who did all this to you."

"B-but why?" asked Luffy with eyes full of hurt and betrayal.

"Well I guess the biggest reason was I had serious doubts at you being the Captain of the Straw Hat Pirates as we head to the New World. Oh, not about your strength, but maybe I should worry about how the events today will affec your fighting ability. No, my concern was your brash, reckless behavior that's not befitting how a leader should act."

Nami took a breath and continued.

"And then I remembered how I've always really loved wearing your straw hat wwhen I had the rare chance to. I decided to test you by going back to what I was when we first met; I was a pirate thief. I wanted to test you that if I could steal your clothes and get you into my own, then you wouldn't be suitable to be Captain anymore. And not only did you fail, you failed so badly that it looks like I broke you."

Nami then glared down at him and said, "Even now, with me right in front of you, do you have the will to try to steal your old hat back?"

Luffy looked down, not in anger, but in hurt and betrayal and believing the words Nami was saying; he didn't deserve to be Captain after the way she had utterly defeated him in her own way.

"I didn't think so. I'm the Captain of the Straw Hat Pirates now, Luffy. Goodbye."

Nami turned and was about to walk away when she heard Luffy speak some more.

"Wait, please don't leave me alone, Nami. Please let me still be a part of the crew."

Nami turned her head in shock and asked, "You still want to be a part of the crew? What can you do?"

"Anything you want... Captain," said Luffy in desperation. "I want to sail with you even if things are different."

Nami shook her head, not expecting this, and said, "Then get up off the ground and follow me. We're heading to the ship to leave. I don't really know what position that I can trust you with, so for now, you will be the cabin boy. Or maybe I should say cabin girl as long as you're in my clothes?"

Luffy got up off the ground and stood straight as he had a smile on his face in gratitude,

"Thanks, Nami. You won't regret it."

"I better not. Let's go."

Nami then turned and started to walk away, with Luffy following his new Captain, happy to still be a part of the Straw Hat Pirates in anyway he could and in some part, happy that Nami had showed him he was in over his head as the Captain. In that moment, Luffy thought the straw hat really suited Nami.



End
